title: examples do not deploy
description: The example configs do not deploy. Investigate if this is an issue with the current state of quad-ops, or a problem with the example compose files
notes:
Investigation findings:

The examples do not deploy because they use quad-ops specific extensions that are not yet implemented in the codebase:

1. **init-containers example** uses `x-quad-ops-init` extension for init containers
   - This extension is documented in site/content/docs/container-management/init-containers.md
   - But the compose spec converter in internal/compose/spec_converter.go does not process extensions
   - No InitContainers field exists in the service.Spec model
   - The extension would need to generate separate Quadlet units for init containers with proper dependencies

2. **multi-service example** uses `x-podman-env-secrets` extension for secrets
   - This extension is used in the wordpress service: `x-podman-env-secrets: db_password: WORDPRESS_DB_PASSWORD`
   - No implementation found in the codebase for processing this extension
   - The converter handles standard compose secrets but not this podman-specific extension

Both extensions are parsed by the compose-go library (stored in project.Extensions) but quad-ops does not process them, causing the examples to fail deployment.

The issue is with quad-ops implementation, not the example compose files.

title: Restore Linux build units functionality
description:
The systemd platform should properly render .build unit files for container build configurations. Currently build specs are not rendered as separate units.

Need to:
- Ensure renderService creates separate artifacts for build specs in spec.Container.Build
- Implement proper Quadlet build unit rendering with build arguments, contexts, and all options
- Add build dependencies to container units (After/Requires)
- Test that build units are created and execute properly

This restores the Linux-specific build management that was lost in the cross-platform abstraction.

title: Add platform-specific feature validation and warnings
description:
Users should be warned when using features that don't work on their platform. Need to add validation during spec conversion.

Need to:
- Detect when Quadlet-specific features (volumes, networks, builds) are used on macOS
- Add validation warnings/errors during spec conversion
- Update compose reader to flag unsupported features per platform
- Add platform capability checking
- Test validation works correctly for both platforms

This will prevent user confusion and provide clear feedback about platform limitations.

title: Update documentation to clarify platform differences
description:
The current documentation claims full Docker Compose support but this is misleading for macOS. Need to clearly document platform differences.

Need to:
- Update README.md to clarify platform-specific feature support
- Add platform comparison table in documentation
- Update feature claims to be platform-specific
- Add migration guide for users moving between platforms
- Update examples to show platform differences

This will set proper user expectations and prevent confusion about feature availability.

title: Fix gosec linting issues in test files
description:
The gosec security linter was disabled due to issues with test files. Need to properly address the security warnings:

- G304: Potential file inclusion via variable (os.ReadFile in tests)
- G301: Directory permissions should be 0750 or less (os.MkdirAll with 0755)
- G306: File permissions should be 0600 or less (os.WriteFile with 0644)

These are legitimate security concerns that should be addressed rather than disabling the linter.

title: Restore Linux volume units functionality
description:
The systemd platform should properly render separate .volume unit files for named volumes from the service spec. Currently volumes are only handled as part of container mounts.

Need to:
- Ensure renderService creates separate artifacts for volumes in spec.Volumes
- Implement proper Quadlet volume unit rendering with all supported options
- Add volume dependencies to container units (After/Requires)
- Test that volume units are created and managed properly

This restores the Linux-specific volume management that was lost in the cross-platform abstraction.

title: Implement macOS volume management for feature parity
description:
While macOS launchd cannot create separate volume units like systemd, we can implement volume lifecycle management to provide better parity.

Need to:
- Research if Podman on macOS supports named volume management
- Implement volume creation/deletion commands for macOS platform
- Add volume validation and lifecycle hooks to launchd platform
- Update status reporting to include volume information
- Test volume operations work correctly on macOS

This would provide basic volume management functionality on macOS, even if not as rich as Linux Quadlet volumes.

title: Implement x-quad-ops-init extension support
description:
The init-containers example uses x-quad-ops-init extension to define init containers that run before the main service. This extension is documented but not implemented.

Need to:
- Add InitContainers field to service.Spec model
- Modify spec_converter.go to process x-quad-ops-init from project.Extensions
- Generate separate service specs for each init container
- Ensure proper systemd dependencies (After/Requires) between init containers and main service
- Handle sequential execution of init containers

Extension format:
```yaml
x-quad-ops-init:
  - image: docker.io/example/image:tag
    command: run this command
  - image: another/image:tag
    command: ["sh", "-c", "multi word command"]
```

- Test dependency handling works correctly on both platforms

This will provide better service orchestration across both Linux and macOS platforms.

title: create config init command
design:

This should:
- follow existing sub-command patterns
- setup a default config in either the default user location or system location pointing to quad-ops examples in the repository
  ```yaml
  repositories:
  - name: quad-ops-compose  # Repository name (required)
    url: "https://github.com/example/repo.git"  # Git repository URL (required)
    ref: "main"  # Git reference to checkout: branch, tag, or commit hash (optional)
    composeDir: "compose"  # Subdirectory where Docker Compose files are located (optional)
  ```
acceptance_criteria: Command successfully creates an example config, has passing tests, and builds successfully

title: Implement x-podman-env-secrets extension support
description:
The multi-service example uses x-podman-env-secrets extension to map secrets to environment variables. This extension is used but not implemented.

Need to:
- Process x-podman-env-secrets from project.Extensions in spec_converter.go
- Add support for mapping secrets to environment variables in the service model
- Ensure the renderer outputs appropriate Podman arguments or systemd environment setup

Extension format:
```yaml
x-podman-env-secrets:
  db_password: WORDPRESS_DB_PASSWORD
```

This should make the secret available as an environment variable in the container.
